original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.44. Cittasahabhūduka, Kusalattika🔽Cittasahabhuṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya  citta saha bhūduka kusalattika  citta sahabhum kusalam dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Chapter on the Triad with the Condition Clause

original: Cittasahabhuṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Abyākatamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva paccayavasena.)
analyzed: citta sahabhum akusalam dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā nava pe avigate nava abyākata mūlam tīṇi eva paccaya vasena
translated: With respect to the wholesome states that are conascent with consciousness, there is the following: With root cause as condition, a wholesome consciousness element arises … (as in the first triad of the first chapter of the first section, §1) … With root cause as condition, a wholesome mental factor arises … With root cause as condition, a wholesome materiality derived from the four great elements arises … With root cause as condition, a wholesome materiality derived from the four great elements and conascent with consciousness arises … With root cause as condition, a wholesome materiality derived from the four great elements and conascent with consciousness arises … With root cause as condition, a wholesome materiality derived from the four great elements and not
